. The Grampians ranges are renown for their hiking trails, wildlife and wildflowers. Their aboriginal name is

The Grampians are a series of uplifted, tilted and eroded ranges. They form the western extremity of the Great Dividing Range. Even from a distance they look spectacular as they rise out of the surrounding plains. The only town and the main access point to the Grampians is Hall’s Gap. 

Dunkeld is a beautiful village set at the southern entrance to the Grampians in the shadow of Mt Sturgeon and Mt Abrupt, the highest mountain in the southern Grampians. It is also a gateway to enter the Grampians from an alternative direction.
There are a number of routes into and through the Grampians. If travelling on the Western Highway from the

direction to Halls Gap, turn off at Stawell. Halls Gap is 260 km from Melbourne. The paved Grampians Tourist Road from Halls Gap to Dunkeld at the southern end of the ranges is a scenic drive through the ranges.
A bus runs from Ballarat to Stawell and connects with another bus to Halls Gap.

, a type of white and pink cockatoo, fly around Halls Gap in large flocks and roost in the trees. The iconic laughing kookaburra can also be heard here.  The noise is quite remarkable.

value: Brambuk National Park and Cultural Centre

the Aboriginal Cultual Centre is a must visit as you can learn about the local indigenous people and see a short film in the Gariwed theatre where you will hear the story of the creator spirit Bunjil. There is also a gift shop, cafe and information can be obtained from National Park.
. There are more than 160 km of trails offering everything from short easy strolls to challenging overnight hikes.
. Take a hike through exciting canyons to the viewing platform on the pinnacle. Marked footpath from Halls Gap or from Wonderland Car Park.
the Grampians are also a popular destination for rock climbers of all skill levels.

. Be the only tourist to climb the Chatauqua Peak. Medium difficulty, some mountaineering experience required for climbing the viewing spot. On the way there, spot wallabies, lizards and more animals and hear the cycads chirp.

There is a supermarket at Halls Gap.

The Black Panther cafe offers great meals with value for money.
It's better than a sandwich chop and less fancy than a restaurant.
Fantastic pizzas.

The Halls Gap bakery offers great pies as well as staples like bread and cakes.

The Kookaburra Bar and Bistro
in Halls Gap offers lunch and dinner, beer garden and lounge, and takeaway liquor sales.

value: content=Has a bistro and restaurant which has won a number of awards
. There are 13 campgrounds throughout the park. All have toilets, fire places and picnic tables and most have water. Pay fees through a self-service permit system at the campgrounds.
is permitted in many, but not all, areas of the park away from the designated campgrounds.
southern end of Halls Gap, opposite the visitor center
price=Dorm bed members $24, non-members $29, double/twin $30 per person, single $54, family room $78

content=Cnr Buckler St and Grampians Rd, Halls Gap. (on the way into Halls Gap from Stawell). A very well-designed, purpose-build hostel inside Grampians National Park. Designed with ecological sustainability in mind, it has features such as solar heating and recycling of shower water to flush toilets. The careful design has extended even to the vegetation plantings. The kitchen is well-equipped with utensils such as knife sharpeners, rice cookers and bread makers (bread-making ingredients are available for purchase). Fresh eggs are available for free from the hen-house. Has 4-bed dorms with lockers and private rooms. Prices may be a bit higher than most hostels but the standard of facilities, cleanliness and service deserve the extra couple of dollars.
on the way into Halls Gap from Stawell
). Small hostel. Extremely friendly, excellent value. Watch the Kangoroos feeding on the nearby cricket grounds.

content=Halls Gap. Three bedrooms, two living areas, two bathrooms, sleeps six. From $140 per night. Very quiet and peaceful with the local hotel a short walk away. Luxurious yet affordable Halls Gap accommodation.
